availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nasby Mills (Knox County, Kentucky, farmer, pvt 7th Ky Inf.)

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Nicia Mills. Father of James Mills and Joseph Mills. Farmer in Barbourville, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from September 22, 1861. Reported as deserted from Jackson, Mississippi, on July 10, 1863. Court martialed on April 24, 1864, and sentenced to confinement at Fort Jefferson, Florida, until May 29, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Payne, p. 67.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 766.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0216.
